div.head: The Names of everal Books printed by Peter Cole at the ign of the Printing-pres in Cornhil neer the Royal Exchange.

list.head: Eleven everal Books by Nich. Culpeper, Gent. Student in Phyick and Atrologie.
list.item: 1 The Practice of Phyick, containing eventeeu everal Books. Wherein is plainly et forth, The Nature, Caue, Differences, and everal orts of Signs; Together with the Cure of al Dieaes in the Body of Man. Being Tranlation of the Works of that Learned and Renowned Doctor, Lazarus Riverius, now living; Councellor and Phyitian to the preent King of France. Above fifteen thouand of the aid Books in Latin have been old in a very few Yeers, having been eight times printed, though al the former Impreions wanted the Nature, Caues, Signs, and Differences of the Dieaes, and had only the Medicines for the cure for them; as plainly appears by the Authors Epitle.

2 Riolanus ix Books of Anatomy and Phyick, containing the Foundation of Phyick and Chyrurgery; wherein all the Body of Man is in uch ort Anatomically diected, as that the Caues and Natures of al Dieaes are demontrated from the Fabrick and ue of the Parts affected.
3 Velingus Anatomy of the Body of Man, Wherein is exactly decribed, the everal Parts of the Body of Man, illutrated with very many larger Bras Plates than ever was in Englih before.
4 A Tranlation of the New dipenatory, made by the Colledg of Phyitians of London. Whereunto is added The Key to Galens Method of Phyick,

5 The Englih Phyician enlarged. being an Atrologo-Phyical Dicoure of the vulgar Herbs of this Nation; wherein is hewed how to cure a mans elf of mot Dieaes incident to Mans Body, with uch things as grow in England, and for three pence charge. Alo in the ame Book is hewed,
1 The time of gathering al Herbs, both Vulgarly and Atrologically.
2 The way of drying, and keeping them and their Juyces. 3 The way of making and keeping al manner of ueful Compounds, made of thoe Herbs. The way of mixing the Medicines according to the Caue, and Mixture of the Dieae, and the part of the Body afflicted.
6 A Directory for Midwives, or a Guide for Women. Newly enlarged by the Author in every heet, and illutrated with divers new Plates.
7 Galens Art of Phyick, with a large Comment.
8 A New Method both of tudying and practiing Phyick.

9 A Treatie of the Rickets, being a Dieae common to Children; wherein is hewed, 1 The Eence, 2 The Caues, 3 The Signs, 4 The Remedies of the Dieae: Publihed in Latin by Dr. Glion, Dr. Bates and Dr. Regemorter, tranlated into Englih, And corrected by N. Culpeper.
10 Medicaments for the Poor, Or Phyick for the Common People.
11 Health for the Rich and Poor, by Dyet without Phyick.

list.head: Twenty one everal Books of Mr. William Brid • e, Collected into two Volumns. Viz.
list.item: 1 Scripture Light the mot ure Light: Compared with, 1. Revelations & Viions 2. Natural & Supernatural Dreams.
3 Impreions with, and without Word 4 Light and Law within. 5. Divine Providence. 6. Chritian Experience. 7. Humane Reaon. 8. Judicial Atrology. Delivered in Sermons, on 2 Pet. 1. 19.

2 Chrit in Travel: Wherein, 1. The Travel of his oul. 2. The firt and after effects of his Death, 3. His Aurance of Iue. 4. And his atisfaction therein Are opened and cleered in Sermons, on Ia. 53 11.

3 A Liting up for the Cat-down, in cae of, 1. Great in. 2. Weaknes of Grace. 3. Micarriage of Duties. 4. Want of Aurance, 5. Affliction. 6 Temptation. 7. Diertion. 8. Unerviceablenes. 9 Dicourage ments from the Condition it elf. Delivered in thirteen Sermons, on Palm; 42. 11. His Four Sermons concerning,
4 Sin againt the Holy Ghot.
5 Sins of Infirmitie.
6 The fale Apotle tried and dicovered
7 The good and means of Etablihment
8 The great things Faith can do.
9 The great things Faith can uffer.
10 The Great Gopel Mytery of the Saints Comfort and Holines, opened and applied from Chrits Prietly Office.
11 Satans power to Tempt, and Chrits Love to, and Care of his People under Tempta • on
12 Thankfulnes required in every Condition.
13 Grace for Grace.
14 The Spiritual Actings of Faith through Natural Impoibilities.
15 Evangelical Repentance
16 The Spiritual Life, &c.
17 The Woman of Canaan.
18 The Saints Hiding place, &c.
19 Chrits Coming is at our Midnight.
20 A Vindication of Gopel Ordinances
21 Grace and Love beyond Gifts
The Caue of our Diviions dicovered, and the Cure propounded.

list.head: Twelve Books of Mr. Jeremiah Burroughs lately publihed; alo the Texts of Scripture upon which they are grounded.
list.item:
1 Gopel Reconciliation, Of Chrits Trumpet of Peace to the World. Wherein is Opened Gods exceeding willingnes to be Reconciled to Man • And Gods ending his B •• b • adors to,
that End from. 2 Cor. 5 19, 20, 21.

2 The Rare Jewel of Chritian Contentment, on Phil. 4. 11. Wherein is hewed, 1 What Contentment is. 2 It is an Holy art and Mytery. 3 The Excellencies of it. 4 The Evil of the contrary in of Murmuring, and the Aggravations of it.
3 Gopel-Worhip, on Levit. 10. 3. Wherein is hewed, 1 The right manner of the Worhip of God in General; And particularly, In hearing the Word, Receiving the Lords upper, & prayer.

4 Gopel-Converation, on Phil. 1 17 Wherein is hewed, 1 That the Converations of Beleevers mut be above what could be by the Light of Nature. 2 Beyond thoe that lived under the Law. 3 And utable to what Truths the Gopel holds forth. The which is added, The Miery of thoe Men that have their Portion in this Life only, on Pal. 17. 14.

5 A Treatie of Earthly-mindednes: Wherein is hewed, 1 What Earthly-mindednes is, 2. The great Evil thereof, on Phil. 3. part of the 19. vere. Alo to the ame Book is joyned, A Treatie of Heavenly-mindednes, and walking with God, on Gen. 5. 24. and on Phil. 3. 20.
6 An Expoition on the fourth, fifth, ixth, and eventh Chapters of the Propheie of Hoea.
7 An Expoition on the eighth, ninth, and tenth Chapters of Hoea.
8 An Expoition on the eleventh, twelfth, and thirteenth Chapters of Hoea, being now compleat.
9 whe Evil of Evils, or the exceeding infulnes of in, on Job 16. 21.
10 Precious Faith, on 2 Pet. 1. 1.
11 Of Hope, on 1 John 3. 3.
12 Of Walking by Faith, on 2 Cor. 5. 7.

Eleven Books made in New-England, by Mr. Thomas Hooker, and printed from his Papers, written with his own hand; are now publihed in three Volumns, two in Quarto, and one in Octavo, viz. The Application of Redemption by the effectual work of the Word, and Spirit of Chrit, for the bringing home of lot inners unto God. The firt Book on 1 Pet. 1. 18, 19. The econd on Matth. 1. 21. The third on Luke, 1. 17. The fourthon 2 Cor. 6. 2 The fift on Matth. 20. 5, 67 The ixt on Revel. 3. 17. The eventh. on Rom. 8. 7. The eighth on John, 6. 44. The Ninth on Ia. 57. 15. The Tenth on Acts, 2. 37. The Lat, viz. Chrits Prayer for Beleevers. On John, v7.
A Godly and Fruitful Expoition, on the firt Epitle of Peter. By Mr. John Rogers, Miniter of the Word of God at Dedham in Eex.
The Wonders of the Loadtone. By Samuel Ward of Ipwich.
An Expoition on the Gopel of the Evangelit St. Matthew. By Mr. VVard.
Clows Chyrurgery.
Marks of Salvation.
Chritians Engagement for the Gopel, by John Goodwin.
Great Church Ordinance of Baptim
Mr. Loves Cae, containing his Petitions, Narrative, and Speech.
Vox Paciica, or a Perwaive to Peace.
Dr. Pretons Saints ubmiion, and Satans Overthrow.
Pious Mans Practice in Parliament time.
Mr. Sympons Sermon at Wetminter
Mr. Feaks Sermon before the Lord Major.
Mr. Phillips Treatie of Hell.—of Chrits Genealogy.
Eaton on the Oath of Allegiance and Covenant, hewing that they oblige not.
A Congregational Church is a Catholick Viible Church. By Samuel Stone in New-England.

A Treatie of Politick Powers, wherein even Quetions are anwered, 1 Whereof Power is made, and for what ordained. 2 Whether Kings and Governors have an Abolute Power over the People. 3 Whther Kings and Governors be ubject to the Laws of God, or the Laws of their Country. 4 How far the People are to obey their Governors. 5 Whether al the People have, be their Governors. 6 Whether it be Lawful to depoe an evil Governor. 7 What Confidence is to be given to Princes.
The Compaionate Samaritan.
Dr. Sibbs on the Philippians.
The Bet and Wort Magitrate. By Obadiah Sedgwick.
The Craft and Cruelty of the Churches Adveraries. By Matthew Newcomin.
A Sacred Penegrick. By Stephen Martial.
Barriffs Military Dicipline.
The Immortality of Mans Soul
The Anatomit Anatomized
King Charls his Cae, or an Appeal to al Rational men concerning his tryal.
Mr. Owens tedatnes of the Promies.

A Vindication of Free Grace: Endeavoring to prove, 1. That we are not elected as holy, but that we hould be holy; and that Election is not of kinds, but perons. 2. that Chrit did not by his death intend to ave all men, and touching thoe whom he intended to ave, that he did not die for them only, if they would beleeve, but that they might beleeve. 3. that we are not jutified properly by our beleeving in Chrit, but by our Chrit, beleeving in him. 4. that which differenceth one man from another, is not the improvement of a common ability retored through Chrit to al men in general, but a principle of Grace wrought by the Spirit of God in the Elect. By John Pawon.

list.head: Six Sermons preached by Doctor Hill. Viz.
list.item: 1 The Beauty and Sweetnes of an Olive Branch of Peace, and Brotherly Accommodation budding.
2 Truth and Love happily married in the Church of Chrit.
3 The Spring of trengthening Grace in the Rock of Ages Chrit Ieus.
4 The trength of the Saints to make Ieus Chrit their trength.
5 The Bet and Wort of Paul.
6 Gods Eternal preparation for his Dying Saints.
The Bihop of Canterbury's Speech on the Scaffold.

The Dicipline of the Church in New-England: By the Churches and Synod there.
A Relation of the Barbadoes.

The Intitutes of the Laws of England, by John Cowel. Octavo.
A Decription of the Grand Signiors Scraglio; or the Turkih Emperors Court. By John Greaves. Octavo.
The reigning Error arraigned at the Bar of Scripture, and Reaon. By Francis Fulwood. Octavo.

div.p: The Fruit in the Womb being often helped by Phyical Remedies, requires no les diligent obervation than the Body it elf of Man: therefore we have given you the repreentation of it in two Tables according to the Method of Diections. The firt of which, laies open to your view the Umbilicar Veels, and the Sccleton: The other the Deliniament of the Bowels.
